definition: to burst or force open a door/to excommunicate sb (from the Roman Catholic Church)/to score a goal (in football, hockey etc)
broken/damaged/worn out/lousy/rotten/to break, split or cleave/to get rid of/to destroy/to break with/to defeat/to capture (a city etc)/to expose the truth of

gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)
surname Men
to break the door down and enter (idiom)
to wear out the doorstep (idiom)/to crowd at sb's door

sentences.english: I remember Thierry Henry flicking a ball over his head and scoring.
sentences.chinese: 我記得亨利輕挑一個球越過他頭頂，然後破門。

sentences.english: That was until Sinclair cracked it home with a fantastic diagonal shot.
sentences.chinese: 直到辛克萊禁區斜角的夢幻施射才破門。

sentences.english: It that man whose house was broken into by burglars last week?
sentences.chinese: 上週家裏被盜賊破門而入的就是那個人嗎？

sentences.english: The Church reacted to this stance with characteristic fury, threatening to excommunicate the president.
sentences.chinese: 教會的反應是這個立場與特徵憤怒，威脅要破門總統。

sentences.english: Thieves break into the palace and steal the king's treasure.
sentences.chinese: 竊賊破門進入宮殿偷走了國王的金銀財寶。

sentences.english: After the thief broke in, there was almost nothing left in the room.
sentences.chinese: 小偷破門而入，屋裏幾乎被洗劫一空。

sentences.english: “Andrew's hut was broken into and some film was stolen,” she said.
sentences.chinese: 安德魯的棚屋被破門而入，一些片子被偷了。

sentences.english: The thief had jumped out of the window before the police broke in.
sentences.chinese: 警察還沒來得及破門進入，小偷就已跳窗逃竄了。

sentences.english: He loves to score goals and was unlucky not to get on the scoresheet today.
sentences.chinese: 他喜歡破門得分，而他今天未能進球實在是不走運。

sentences.english: However, Li Kai very quick completed has forced a door open, lets on the stand belong to tranquilly .
sentences.chinese: 不過，李凱很快就完成了破門，讓看臺上歸於平靜。

sentences.english: A neighbor called police and reported two men trying to break into the house.
sentences.chinese: 一個鄰居報警說有兩個男人正試圖破門進入他家。

sentences.english: Charless scored again, with an exact duplicate of his first goal.
sentences.chinese: 查爾斯再次得分，與第一次破門如出一轍。

sentences.english: Thief broke out the door when the owner was on vocation.
sentences.chinese: 屋主外出度假時，有賊破門進入。

sentences.english: A thieve broke in when the house owner went out on vacation.
sentences.chinese: 屋主外出度假時，有賊破門進入。

sentences.english: The thief broke into the house during the night.
sentences.chinese: 小偷在夜間破門進入住宅。

definition: 12-yard (sports)/penalty kick
to mess sth up/to screw up
to turn defeat into victory (idiom); to turn the tide
(sports) to steal/to intercept the ball
firefighting/to extinguish a fire and save life and property/to dive (of goalkeeper in soccer)
to lift a siege/to help sb out of trouble or embarrassment
visiting team (sports)
red card (sports)
hat trick (when one player scores three goals)
restricted area/forbidden region
chaotic warfare/confused fighting/melee/to join in such fighting
goalkeeper
Minnesota, USA
to assault a fortified position/(fig.) to concentrate one's efforts on a particularly difficult part of one's mission
pass (in soccer)/to feed (ball)
fireman
